citation.article-title: Pontibacillus litoralis sp. nov., a facultatively anaerobic bacterium isolated from a sea anemone, and emended description of the genus Pontibacillus
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Pontibacillus litoralis sp. nov.
Pontibacillus litoralis (li.to.ra′lis. L. masc. adj. litoralis of or belonging to the seashore).
Cells are facultatively anaerobic, moderately halophilic, catalase- and oxidase-positive, Gram-positive rods, approximately 0.4–0.8 μm wide and 3.5–5.0 μm long.
Motile by means of peritrichous flagella and bear ellipsoidal endospores that lie in subterminal swollen sporangia.
Colonies are creamy white-pigmented, flat and non-translucent with glistening surfaces and circular/slightly irregular margins, 1–2 mm in diameter after incubation at 35 °C on MA for 2–5 days.
No diffusible pigments are produced.
Growth occurs at pH 6.0–10.0 (optimum, pH 7.5) and 15–50 °C (optimum, 35 °C).
Growth occurs in the presence of 0.5–15 % (w/v) NaCl in complex medium [optimum, 2–5 % (w/v) NaCl].
Does not grow with NaCl as a sole salt.

Positive for methyl red test, nitrate reduction and fermentation of glucose, but negative for H2S and indole production, nitrite reduction, Voges–Proskauer test, phenylalanine deaminase and lysine and ornithine decarboxylases.
Respiration on nitrate, nitrite and fumarate under anaerobic conditions is not observed.
Aesculin, gelatin and Tween 40 are hydrolysed, but casein, DNA, hypoxanthine, starch, Tweens 20, 60 and 80, urea and xanthine are not.

Acid is produced from d-fructose, d-glucose, maltose, sucrose, trehalose and turanose, but not from adonitol, l-arabinose, dulcitol, d-galactose, glycerol, myo-inositol, lactose, d-mannitol, d-mannose, melezitose, melibiose, raffinose, l-rhamnose, d-ribose, d-salicin, d-sorbitol or d-xylose.

Utilizes d-fructose, d-glucose, glycerol, maltose and d-mannitol as sole carbon sources and l-alanine and l-asparagine as sole nitrogen sources, but not l-arabinose, cellobiose, dextrin, d-fructose, d-galactose, lactose, d-mannose, melezitose, melibiose, raffinose, l-rhamnose, d-ribose, d-salicin, sucrose, trehalose, d-xylose, adonitol, d-arabitol, myo-inositol, d-sorbitol, acetate, butyrate, citrate, gluconate, propionate, l-arginine, l-glutamic acid, glycine, l-histidine, hydroxy-l-proline, l-isoleucine, l-leucine, l-methionine, l-proline, l-serine and l-valine.
Positive for alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase and naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase.

Negative for acid phosphatase, α-chymotrypsin, cystine arylamidase, α-fucosidase, α- and β-galactosidases, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α- and β-glucosidases, β-glucuronidase, lipase (C14), α-mannosidase, trypsin and valine arylamidases.

Cells are susceptible to (μg per disc): ampicillin (30), carbenicillin (30), chloramphenicol (30), gentamicin (10), kanamycin (30), lincomycin (2), rifampicin (5) and streptomycin (10), but not to nalidixic acid (20), novobiocin (30), polymixin B (30) or tetracycline (30).
meso-Diaminopimelic acid is present in the cell-wall peptidoglycan as the diagnostic diamino acid.
The predominant menaquinone is MK-7.
The major cellular fatty acids are iso-C15 : 0 and anteiso-C15 : 0.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 41.3 mol% (HPLC method).

The type strain, JSM 072002T (=DSM 21186T=KCTC 13237T), was isolated from homogenates of a surface-sterilized sea anemone (Anthopleura xanthogrammica) collected from a tidal flat of a China island, Naozhou, located at the edge of the South China Sea, China.
